<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Imp](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3067)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Imps are fiendish infiltrators and corrupters who, despite their diminutive stature, are more than capable of subtly influencing a weak-willed individual into performing increasingly evil acts over time. An imp will often agree to serve a mortal and act docile and loyal in a long-term plot to eventually get their master killed or damn their soul. Imps are born directly from the Outer Planes themselves, rather than from mortal souls, and thus they serve outside any fiendish hierarchies, granting them leeway to pursue their specialties.

 Despite standing a mere 2 feet tall, imps can be vicious combatants, flying out of reach and turning invisible to escape should the odds turn against them.

<column gap="tiny">

([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 15

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13

</column>

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 1">[Imp](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3067)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Tiny" />
<trait label="Fiend" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=600" />
<trait label="Unholy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=521" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 206 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +7; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Chthonian](/Languages.aspx?ID=114), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Daemonic](/Languages.aspx?ID=31), [Diabolic](/Languages.aspx?ID=117); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=79) (touch)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +7, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +6, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +7, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +5

<row gap="medium">
**Str** -1

**Dex** +4

**Con** +0

**Int** +1

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +2
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 17 

**Fort** +5 

**Ref** +9 

**Will** +7 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 15

</row>

**Resistances**
[poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669) 3

**Weaknesses**
[holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517) 3

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 20 feet, fly 30 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
stinger +9 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 0 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)),
**Damage** 1d4–1 piercing plus imp venom

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 17
- **Cantrips (1st)**
[Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66)
- **1st**
[Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34)
- **2nd**
[Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (at will; self only)
- **4th**
[Read Omens](/Spells.aspx?ID=247)

**[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127)) The imp takes on the appearance of a Medium or smaller [animal](/Traits.aspx?ID=531) (page 358). While transformed, the imp loses their normal senses, innate spells, and special actions, but doesn't otherwise change their statistics and can still speak and use telepathy. The imp also gains any special senses of the animal and any Speeds the animal has. This doesn't change the attack and damage modifiers of their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal (depending on what kinds of attacks the animal has) and prevents them from exposing creatures to imp venom.

**Fiendish Healing** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89), [Vitality](/Traits.aspx?ID=509)) **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The imp regains 1d6 Hit Points.

**Fiendish Temptation** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=76), [Unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521)) **Frequency** once per day; **Effect** The imp offers a non-[fiend](/Traits.aspx?ID=600) within 15 feet a bargain, granting a boon of good luck if the creature accepts voluntarily. The boon lasts for 1 hour once accepted. Once during the hour, the creature can roll an attack roll or saving throw twice and use the higher result. If the creature dies while the boon is in place, the imp decides where the creature's soul travels. This typically makes the soul bound for eternity in the imp's home plane, and the creature unable to be raised or resurrected except by the [_wish_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=125) ritual or similar magic.

**Imp Venom**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) **Saving Throw** DC 16 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 1d6 poison and [clumsy 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=61) (1 round); **Stage 2** 1d6 poison damage, clumsy 1, and [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=92) (1 round)

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_3_Locations.png">Imps of Many Planes</title>

Like rats infesting cities, imps litter the fiendish Outer Planes—[Abaddon](/Planes.aspx?ID=37), the [Outer Rifts](/Planes.aspx?ID=45), and most especially [Hell](/Planes.aspx?ID=42). Imps love to learn the tricks of [devils](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=389), the better to tempt mortals and confine souls. Over centuries spent on the various planes, imps begin to take on the characteristics of the environment they inhabit, often looking flamescorched if they come from Hell, caustic and monstrous if from the Outer Rifts, and red-eyed and fetid if from Abaddon.
</aside>
